thread.title: Deep dive into Rubens’ ‘Prometheus Bound’ in Philly
thread.title_full: Deep dive into Rubens’ ‘Prometheus Bound’ in Philly

author: Jeanne Cooper
title: Deep dive into Rubens’ ‘Prometheus Bound’ in Philly
text:
Deep dive into Rubens’ ‘Prometheus Bound’ in Philly Jeanne Coope , San Francisco Chronicle By Jeanne Cooper Published 4:05 pm, Thursday, September 17, 2015 Photo: Philadelphia Museum Of Art Image 1 of / 5 Close Image 1 of 5 
Peter Paul Rubens’ “Prometheus Bound” (1611-12) is the centerpiece of “The Wrath of the Gods: Masterpieces by Rubens, Michelangelo, and Titian,” opening Sept. 12 at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. Photo: Philadelphia Museum Of Art Peter Paul Rubens’ “Prometheus Bound” (1611-12) is the... Image 2 of 5 
The hop-on, hop-off Quito Bus is part of the Bucket Pass, which offers a mobile app and discounted admission to major attraction in Ecuador's capital. Photo: Quito Bus The hop-on, hop-off Quito Bus is part of the Bucket Pass, which... Image 3 of 5 
Numerous historic structures tied to the ancient Korean kingdom of Baekje, including Baekhwajeong Pavilion, are part of Korea’s newest UNESCO World Heritage Site. Photo: Seo Heun-kang, Baejke Historic Sites Numerous historic structures tied to the ancient Korean kingdom of... Image 4 of 5 
The striking Baroque facade of the Santiago de Compostela Cathedral, visited on Country Walkers’ new nine-day, self-guided tour of the Camino de Santiago in Spain, was completed in 1740. Photo: Country Walkers The striking Baroque facade of the Santiago de Compostela... Image 5 of 5 
The 125-room Strand Hotel Swakopmund in Namibia, opening Oct. 9, is a four-star hotel with modern design influenced by the country’s German heritage. Photo: Strand Hotel Swakopmund The 125-room Strand Hotel Swakopmund in Namibia, opening Oct. 9, is... Deep dive into Rubens’ ‘Prometheus Bound’ in Philly 1 / 5 Back to Gallery 
New exhibition 
Philadelphia: “The Wrath of the Gods: Masterpieces by Rubens, Michelangelo, and Titian” brings together for the first time Rubens’ dramatic painting “Prometheus Bound” with artworks that inspired it. It is on view at the Philadelphia Museum of Art through Dec. 6. www.philamuseum.org. 
Walking tour 
Spain: Follow in the steps of countless pilgrims (but in more comfort) on Country Walkers’ nine-day, self-guided tour of the Camino de Santiago. About a tenth the length of the traditional 500-mile route, the tour starts in Pamplona and ends at Santiago de Compostela; from $3,698. www.countrywalkers.com. 
World heritage 
Korea: Fortresses, temples, tombs and palaces of the ancient kingdom of Baekje in the mountainous midwest form a new UNESCO World Heritage Site. Take new weekend bus tours from Buyeo to explore the historic areas. http://english.visitkorea.or.kr. 
New hotel 
Namibia: Built on the Mole, Swakopmund’s landmark seawall, the four-star, 125-room Strand Hotel Swakopmund offers Atlantic Ocean views and modern design inspired by the country’s German heritage — including a microbrewery and beer garden. It opens Oct. 9; from $188. www.strandhotelswakopmund.com. 
Sightseeing 
Ecuador: Ride the tourist Quito Bus and visit Quito’s La Compañía church , the City Museum , Capilla del Hombre (“Chapel of Man”) museum and the Middle of the World complex, all via the Bucket Pass. Ordered online, the pass includes a mobile app and printable tickets, at a 20 percent discount: $32.50 adult, $20 senior, $13.50 child. www.bucketpass.com. Top Stories
